abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes how Volkswagen's admission of cheating emissions test through use of proprietary software has confirmed fears expressed by law Prof Eben Moglen about lack of transparency regarding such software five years earlier; notes car makers and Environmental Protection Agency both oppose opening up code governing cars to scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: The automaker’s admission that it used proprietary software code to cheat emissions tests shows why Eben Moglen, a Columbia University law professor, has long argued for making such code transparent.

headline.main: Volkswagen’s Diesel Fraud Makes Critic of Secret Code a Prophet
headline.print_headline: Diesel Scheme Makes Prophet of Code Critic

snippet: The automaker’s admission that it used proprietary software code to cheat emissions tests shows why Eben Moglen, a Columbia University law professor, has long argued for making such code transparent.
